description: From Latin medicātus, past participle of medicō; Equivalent to medic +‎ -ate.

verbs.description: medicate (third-person singular simple present medicates, present participle medicating, simple past and past participle medicated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To prescribe or administer medication to.
(transitive, of a substance) To have a medicinal or healing effect on a person, body part, or ailment; to act on.
